::: {.the-story}
## A House With Stories to Tell

::: {.timeline}
::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">1854</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**Built**
John McCrea constructs this Greek Revival townhouse with white marble steps‚Äîa Philadelphia signature.
</div>
:::

::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">1891</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**First Chronicle**
Seven-year-old Howard Spencer Jr. fights scarlet fever in an upstairs bedroom‚Äîthe first documented personal story.
</div>
:::

::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">1899</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**Grand Transformation**
Renowned architects Duhring, Okie & Ziegler renovate the house into its current Gilded Age glory.
</div>
:::

::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">1901</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**Society Wedding**
The Rolin-Plumb wedding breakfast fills the double parlors with elaborate floral arrangements.
</div>
:::

::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">1915</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**Suffragette Headquarters**
Martha Davis sells Equal Franchise Society tickets from the entry hall‚Äîwomen's voices rising in these rooms.
</div>
:::

::: {.timeline-item}
<div class="timeline-year">2024</div>
<div class="timeline-content">
**Your Story**
What history will you write in these rooms?
</div>
:::
:::
